sen.j: 庄 弘方（しょう ひろかた、生没年不詳）は、平安時代末期から鎌倉時代の武蔵国児玉党（現在の埼玉県本庄市栗崎出身）の武士。
sen.e: Hirokata SHO (the year of birth and death unknown) was a warrior of the Kodama party of Musashi Province (present Kurisaki, Kodama-cho, Honjo City, Saitama Prefecture) from the end of the Heian period to the Kamakura period.

Hirokata SHO (the year of birth and death unknown) was a warrior of the Kodama party of Musashi Province (present Kurisaki, Kodama-cho, Honjo City, Saitama Prefecture), who lived from end of the Heian period to the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「平安末期から鎌倉時代」に「〜した」という部分が欠落していましたので追加し意味が通るようにしました。

sen.e: He was the fifth son (the youngest child) of Iehiro SHO, who was the fourth family head of the Sho head family of the Kodama party.

sen.j: 庄五郎弘方は、庄忠家や庄高家など他の兄弟と共に源氏方に属し、各戦に参戦した児玉党の武士である。
sen.e: Goro Hirokata SHO was a warrior of the Kodama party on the side of the Minamoto clan as well as his brothers, such as Tadaie SHO and Takaie SHO, and participated in battles in those days.
Goro Hirokata SHO was a warrior of the Kodama party who stood on the side of the Minamoto clan and participated in battles, along with his other brothers including Tadaie SHO and Takaie SHO.
sen.cmt: 「and participated〜」の最後の部分は「源型に属し、」とつながっている方が良いと考え、語順を修正しました。
sen.e: Goro Hirokata SHO was a warrior of the Kodama party who stood on the side of the Minamoto clan and participated in battles, along with his other brothers including Tadaie SHO and Takaie SHO.

sen.j: 『源平盛衰記』によれば、宇治川の戦い（1184年）において、「淀川の先陣争い」で、先陣（佐々木高綱や梶原景季）に続いて川を渡った事が記されており、武勇人として知られている。
sen.e: He was known as a man of military prowess, recorded in the "Genpei Seisui ki (Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Heike clans)": in the Battle of Uji-gawa River (in 1184), he followed the vanguard (Nobutsuna SASAKI and Kagesue KAJIWARA) to cross the river, which is known for 'contention for the vanguard at Yodo-gawa River.'
sen.cmt: 「淀川の先陣争い」となっておりますが、Ｗｅｂでも「宇治川の先陣争い」とあり、ミスであると思われますが、そのまま「淀川」としました
sen.e: He is known as a man of military prowess, recorded in the "Genpei Seisui ki (Rise and Fall of the Minamoto and the Heike clans)": in the Battle of Uji-gawa River (in 1184), he followed the vanguard (Nobutsuna SASAKI and Kagesue KAJIWARA) to cross the river, which is known for 'contention for the vanguard at Yodo-gawa River.'
sen.cmt: 現存する書物によってその武勇が「現在」知られているという意味のほうが強いですので、現在形に修正しました。

sen.j: そのまま源範頼軍に従い、一ノ谷の戦いにも参戦した。
sen.e: Joining the army of MINAMOTO no Noriyori after that, he also fought in the Battle of Ichinotani.

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』によれば、承久3年（1221年）に起きた承久の乱において、北条泰時（鎌倉幕府）軍に従い、山城国の宇治橋合戦で、庄四郎と共に敵を一人ずつ生け捕る功績を上げるが、この戦で兄の一人である三郎忠家が戦死している。
sen.e: The "Azuma Kagami (Mirror of Eastern Japan; historical account of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feadal government headed by a shogun))" describes that in the War of Jokyu (attempt by the Retired Emperor Gotoba to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu), which took place in 1221, he sided with the army of Yasutoki HOJO (the Kamakura bakufu), and at the Battle of Uji-bashi Bridge of Yamashiro Province, he showed an achievement that he and his brother, Shiro SHO, each captured one enemy alive, but one of their brothers, Saburo Tadaie, was killed in that battle.
sen.cmt: 吾妻鏡→(hisstorical account of the Kamakura bakufu)を補足しました/承久の乱→(attempt by the \retired Emperor Gotoba to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu)を補足しました
sen.e: According to the "Azuma Kagami (Mirror of Eastern Japan; historical account of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun))" Hirokata participated in the War of Jokyu (attempt by the Retired Emperor Gotoba to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu) in 1221 on the side of Yasutoki HOJO (the Kamakura bakufu); Hirokata showed an achievement that he himself and his brother Shiro SHO each captured one enemy alive at the Battle of Uji-bashi Bridge of Yamashiro Province, while one of their brothers Saburo Tadaie was killed in that battle.
sen.cmt: 原文が様々な内容を一文に含めたもので致し方ないと思いますが、これら別々の内容の文を接続詞でつなぐ際、肯定になったり否定になったりで意味が取りづらいと思います。その点留意して修正しました。
sen.e: According to the "Azuma Kagami (Mirror of Eastern Japan; historical account of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun))" Hirokata participated in the War of Jokyu (attempt by the Retired Emperor Gotoba to overthrow the Kamakura bakufu) in 1221 on the side of Yasutoki HOJO (the Kamakura bakufu); Hirokata showed an achievement that he himself and his brother Shiro SHO each captured one enemy alive at the Battle of Uji-bashi Bridge of Yamashiro Province, while one of their brothers Saburo Tadaie was killed in that battle.

sen.j: 庄五郎弘方は栗崎を南下して、現在の児玉町入浅見地区に移住し、阿佐美氏の祖になったとされる（阿佐美庄五郎弘方として系図に記されている）。
sen.e: Moving southward from Kurisaki, Goro Hirokata SHO settled at what is now Iriazami, Kodama-cho, and he is said to have been the founder of the Asami clan (its family tree records him as Goro Hirokata SHO ASAMI).

sen.e: Moving southward from Kurisaki, Goro Hirokata SHO settled at what is now known as Iriazami, Kodama-cho, and he became the founder of the Asami clan (its family tree records him as Goro Hirokata SHO ASAMI).
sen.cmt: 「he is said to have been」は冗長ですので、簡略化しました。

sen.j: 阿佐美氏は上州、越州、加州の方にも領地を獲得する事となる（詳細は庄家長の方を参照）。
sen.e: As time passed on, the Asami clan also gained its territory in Joshu (present, a part of Ishikawa Prefecture and Fukui Prefecture), Esshu (Toyama Prefecture), and Kashu (Niigata Prefecture of the main land) (See Ienaga SHO for more information).
